title: Calories in Cough Drops
meta_description: Learn calories in cough drops per piece, including carbs, sugars, and full nutrition breakdown for common menthol varieties.
assumptions: Standard menthol cough drops (e.g., Halls brand); hard candy style, approximately 3-4g per drop, with sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, sugar content, and size. Sugar-free options differ; check labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One standard cough drop contains about 5 calories, primarily from sugars.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Menthol with eucalyptus (herbal extract, no extra sugar)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cough drop?
faqs.a: Typically 5 calories for a standard sugar-based menthol cough drop.

faqs.q: Are cough drops high in sugar?
faqs.a: About 1g of sugars per drop, contributing to the low calorie count.

faqs.q: Do sugar-free cough drops have calories?
faqs.a: Usually 0 calories, sweetened with sorbitol or aspartame.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in cough drops?
faqs.a: Around 1.3g carbs per drop, mostly simple sugars with no fiber.

faqs.q: How many cough drops equal a full candy's calories?
faqs.a: 10-15 drops (50-75 kcal) approximate one small hard candy.
